column5: Wowzers, good thing i dont lay down money on my hunches lol
Yeah that I-desk observation was my thread a while back.............goood thing the hockey made up for this intermission flop

And by the by, i could NOT be more thrilled for a stanley cup winner than i am right now. (unless it was my home team of course)  Am i a meanie because i enjoyed watching the red helmets hung low as the pens skated around their home rink with the cup held high? Yeah maybe..........but the guilt wore off quick when detroit booed the cup winners. Its expected, but it made hating the wings that much easier lol
Did I say WOOOO HOOOOO?
HOSSA? MORE LIKE....NO-SSA!

The Media and Detroit fans thought they had the series once they were up 0-2 in the first two games. But many fans-myself included knew they could come through. The most important thing here is there lower line scoring that came to life and made this thing happen. Some teams want the cup and some teams deserve the cup, Pens deserved to win as they never gave up hope and fought through every period to stay alive. Detroit just plays good, didn't see to much inspiration from them but hey maybe i don't know what to look for.  All I know is that Crosby is the youngest captain to raise the Cup for his team and this is a amazing accomplishment, not to mention the maturing that this team still has to go through to become even better. Congratulations to the outstanding victory of winning the Stanley Cup! As for stats-Pittsburgh has not lost in a game 7 in the playoffs, but hey who says stats are always right.  Only been watching hockey for a couple of years now and that game has to be my most memorable.   MTBF
Congrat's to Pitt, the best team won this year. Great game 7!

Thank God I started drinking at 3pm. It softened the blow.  :lol:   Congrats to the young guns. I guess I'll go  fishing now and on my way home I'll stop in and pay my debt.  <_<  Go Leafs Go!!!  :lol:  And no cracks about being a loser Please!!!  :lol:

1 - Your right 2 - I was at the game and there wasn't an empty seat in the house. in between periods, the lines up and wait for bathrooms are so long... It looks empty till about 12 mins left in the period haha 3 - We weren't booing the cup winner.... We were booing The person handing the cup to the winner !!!! BETTMAN ! 4 - What age is " old " ? 5 - Again, your right .  Overall.... VERY disappointed in the game, Couldn't believe it ! Still got to see a cup lifted I guess.... not the same feeling if Detroit would of hoisted it though.  Congrats Pens !

It's Game 7 and halfway through the period there was a noticeable number of empty seats.  I don't care where the fans were, they should be watching that game.  How old?  Old enough for Mike Babcock to tell the media the Wings were out of gas.    Don't get me wrong, they're still a great team but old man time is creeping in.  Did I say WOOOOOOHOOOOOO?
I'm not crazy about the pens winning cause they took out my Caps.They looked much better than the wings last night for sure.I still hate you Marty. Joe
Great game and great series. The best team won. Anyone can win a game or two- thats why it is best of seven. To all the guys previously dumping on the Pens and lauding the wings- you were wrong.
I'm happy for Hal Gill, good to see the big guy hoist the cup. As for the rest of them...nothing good to say.

I'm happy with that. A rematch next year????....best outta 3 LOL!  Hardest Job was picking an MVP though... I suppose Malkin was as deserving as anyone else, but truth be told I find that a weak pick. But don't ask me who I would have picked over him? he had a huge amount of points, but a dismal 2 way performance, and if it were not for being on the powerplay you can minus16 points (7 goals 9 assists )...with a 36 over all points thats not that impressive, and niether is only having a +3 plus minus at the end of the playoffs?  Impressive show for TV, but as a coach, fan, and fly by night analyist...not desreving of the MVP. But then again, who would be better? I suppose stats wise... Crosby would be the winner by a 7 point regulation time performance margin, and a +9  plus minus puts his effectivness 6 points over Malkan. But then again if Bettman makes those calls then the media hype(he who scores most) will win every time....loved his shout out to Mario LOL!  But for last night in general...Talbot deserves a HUGE thank you from the fans, and his team mates. He worked his butt off!  Sai la vie... Pitty won fair an square, and deserve to enjoy the warmth of the spot light for a while.  Cheers,
wow im sick, good 7 games though

After going through all the posts, I feel better. I'm not the biggest loser. Marion Hossa is.  :lol:  What are the chances of him asking to be traded back to Pittsburgh?  :lol:  Cheers All!  Oh Ya, the bite was on for carp, but I'm bored. Bass opener can't come soon enough.
but will  he play??????????
I think he'll come on at the end so he's on the ice when they win.
Nevermind
Go Pens Go!
Hold on to your butts...it just got interesting...
PENS WIN
Is that Sidney with the CUP?  Where is Stoty??? LOL!!  Oh and does this mean Hossa will be headed back to Pittsburgh?
W00T!
She's all over but the crying  :Gonefishing:  :Gonefishing:  :Gonefishing:  :G
Hey Stotty where are ya .. whipe them tears away and admit with the rest of the wings fans that the better team won
Heee Heee Heee

Great game! I know some gambling-type guys at work who betted with innocent folks who wanted the Pens to win. Odds were definitely with the Wings.  Nice to see the underdog win and odds players have to pay out to kind-hearted folks.  And eat crow ya buggars here who were thumping their "odds-are" chests.
Kudos to Malkin, and Fleury. They deserve it for sure. Detroit didn't play like it was a game 7 that's for sure. Can't argue that win.
with two great teams like det and pit i think you can through odds out the window
No Scoty, no need to even speak after that game. Detroit is a excellent team but never judge a series before it's done.  Great job by both teams!

Atta boy, Stoty...well said...not like those babies in the stands at the Joe who had the gall to boo the Pens while they hoisted the silverware.  I don't imagine there will be a series like this for a while to come...
CROW IS SERVED!
Chirp me all you want, but at least I stuck by my team win or lose! I didn't hear much after game 5 from you "pens fans".
i couldn't have cared who won this game only glad  that Hossa lost i wonder what team he thinks has the best chance  to win this year hopefullly not NJ or i will have to switch teams

Even though I'm on the same boat with Stoty by always wanting Detroit to win, I decided to bet against them once I saw everyone jump on the bandwagon this year. For many years I bet for Detroit but I had a feeling this year was different. The media made it seem like the Pens had no chance especially by showing these statistics where the home team always wins. Never count a team. Kudos to Talbot, Malkin, & Fleury. Osgood is still the MVP of the playoffs. Great game.
most of us aren't "pens" fans... we just don't like detroit.

It's one big party here now!   Wow!    We are the Champs!  I had the wonderful experience of watching the Cup win with 14 little boys between 6 and 10 years old.   It was AWESOME!   These kids will never forget how awesome it was.  The excitement was ridiculous.  Five observations: 1. Fleury came up HUGE!  I was worried about him.    2. Alot of empty seats in Detroit.   3.  Classless fans.   Booing the Cup winner?  Detroit deserves the misery. 4.  They are getting old.   Pens got to more loose pucks tonite than in any other game.  5. PENS ARE YOUNG!  Jump on the wagon!  Super Bowl and Stanley Cup in same year.       And to be the world's best fisherman, we have the trifecta here in Pittsburgh.    Yeeeeehaaaawww!  Lucky for the world that the Pirates suck, my ego would be worse than it is!
Classless fans and an old hockey team makes for a bunch of losers!
Can Pittsburg win in Detroit ??? Gonna be tough to win the cup in the motor city. We'll find out soon.  GO PENS !!!
I could care less as to who wins, or which player is hot or not. I let the others pretend they're the Cherry  .  All I want to see is good hockey.
Wouldn't really mind if Pittsburg wins tonight , as long as Crosby is not in on the Action....   Then the headlines will read ,,,,,,  Crosby leads the Pens to the Stanley Cup..
All i know is that i am jacked for the game!!!  Got me right excited!!
I wont predict the winner, but i am predicting a lopsided game whichever way it goes

That would suck. Neither team deserves to lose. It should be a helluva game with the best team winning. I'd like to see both teams and all players leave the game with heads high. I don't often feel like this about a series but I find myself kinda admiring what both teams have accomplished, the Wings for consistency and the Pens for coming back, and I'm not just talking about the series.  JF

I got my beer earlier today, got my bait for tomorrow. The only thing I forgot was champagne for the celebration  after THE BIG RED MACHINE wins me my bet. I'm SO looking forward to this game!!!!! I gotta say though, if I  hadn't bet Detroit before the playoffs started , I'd be hoping Pittsburgh would win it.  GAME 7-STANLEY CUP FINAL LETS GET IT ON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Enjoy the game!!
Lets hope it gets decided in OT.
No! I'll fall asleep by then
NO NO NO ... I have my alarm set for 4 .. if it goes too far I wont get any sleep before slaying the Perch in Erie  GO PENS GO
So far it doesn't look like it's shaping up to be lopsided....great 1st period!
That was fun!  What's up with all the empty seats?
Marty,start the party,
let's hope the pens can hold off these fools so i can begin serving crow...cold!
SSSTTTTTTOOOOOOOTTTTTTYYYYYYYY  where arrrrrreeeeee yyyyyyyoooouuuuuu?
lots of hockey to go .. lets hope they can hold on to the lead .. GO PENS GO
I love how NOW they throw out the stats of how many games numerous Red Wings players have gone without a goal.  Keep shootin' Pens...keep shootin!
I have a feeling that there may be some upset people at the end.  Quote: "Hee hee hee"
This could be a really long 20 minutes. I don't wanna pop any corks just yet.  JF
The wings are being dominated by the pens. It's like they have no real drive to win.
Hopefully Crosby will be back
Dont count them out yet...the wings have a tendency to do things in bunches....

They look pretty serious to me, but the Pens are hustling.  So much for the lack of depth some accused the Pens of. They're going pretty deep from where I'm watching. I'm not sure they even noticed Sid was off the bench for part of the second. But can they sustain this pace? Hopefully.  JF

you are right one nice goal or one bad bounce and it is a whole new game and the puck has really been bouncing tonite don't know what is up with the bad ice  franzen hit was a bit late on crosby but was not an intentional knee (or groin) on knee hit

Sid's back....and I see what somebody meant about the i-desk...it's definitely rated G...A.Y.  A 2 goal lead is certainly not enough insurance against the wings...but if Pitt's defence keeps it up...it might be all right.

Dude Pitty out shot them out hit them, out scored them.....they out played them. The zone percentage after the 2nd was like 80% in the Detroit defensive? If not for Osgood the score would have been run up grossly.
Are you kidding Stoty? Pit outplayed Detroit throughout the game save for a bit at the end. Osgood was the reason they were still in it. Maybe you didn't watcfh the first 8/9ths of the game.

stoty has demonstrated that he watches the game through red coloured goggles several times already...let him make excuses for his team getting outplayed and let's hope pittsburgh plays game 7 with the same intensity, ESPECIALLY from the 3rd and 4th lines.  anybody else think guerin had a really sloppy and lazy game?
Good game.... Game 7 baby ! WOOOO

Say what you want Stoty and the other Wings apologists, Detroit has lost 3 of the last 4 games in this series.    The Wings are good and still could win the Cup but they aren't that much better than the Pens.  Now that this series has come down to one game, game 5 is now irrelevant and I just hope Fleury can put one good game together on Wings' ice.  God, I wish the Pens had home ice.   They'd be favored to win that game.  And, by the way, the others are dead on.   Osgood kept that game close.   The Pens dominated the play tonite.   Here's to hoping these kids can find a way to win in Detroit.  And yes, I think Billy Guerin looked sloppy tonite.   Orpik struggled too. Say what you want about Malkin but the guy is the catalyst right now.   I'm hoping Sid hasn't played his best game yet.   Let's get this town a Cup to go along with our Super Bowl trophy.
Actually not a Bad Game.  Some Hitting, Great goaltending, and end to end action.  Now will someone Cream that yellow turncoat Ottawa product HOSSA
Pitts did deserve the win and its about time you realized your team has only won from the lucky bounces
Go PENGUINS Go!!!
Yea... lucky bounces.... 5 of them in game 5 !!!   :dunno:    Who is this guy ? haha

Going to be a exciting game 7 in Detroit. As before, i still have not changed my guess on what team will lift the Stanley Cup(Pittsburgh).   Detroit is a good team and when ever they get the puck I'm at the edge of my seat. Let the best and most effective team win the Stanley Cup!  Let's Go Pens!  MTBF

The first entire hockey game I have watched all season. The Pens owned 2 periods and the Wings owned the 3rd. Lotsa hitting, great goaltending...at both ends...and the refs let them play. This was the best NHL game I have seen in a long time.  Malkin was a bum last night and could have cost them the game with that dumb arse penalty in the 3rd.  The Pens proved to me last night they can play well enough to beat Detroit. I never believed that before last night.  Too bad I'll be at the cottage...with no cable...for game 7. Which if you believe is superstition, means the Pens will lose...cause if I'm NOT watching the game...the team I am rooting for almost always loses.
you gotta find yourself a bar near the cottage then!!! Go Pens!!!

I agree, Whats with Orpik and dropping his stick  It happened about 4 -5 times Last night? Billy was a bit off for sure, no Major mistakes but not as much presence. Malkans a great player offensively most of the time, but he had huge problems gaining the Blue line last night, and gave up some very dangerous turnovers by trying to get to fancy....The whole teams gotta come on strong Friday if they are gonna pull it off. Truth be told I'm not sure fleury is up for it... The Pitty defence had better bring it on, and guys like Malkan better remember what 2 way hockey is all about or the Wings will take it to them.  I'm not sure that 50% of last nights Penguin win was not 50% attributed to the Wings Offence having an off night. Its was shown in spades what the wings can do when the Pens defence is not effective, and by defence I mean back checking forwards as well... Fleury is good, but he's shaken, and Detroit has the guns to Rattle him again.  Lets hope Pitty scores first, and they get confidence quickly...cause we've seen it go the other way and it wasn't pretty

Malkin looked sloppy, yes, but Hossa has been skating with a yellow streak behind him for a while now...almost pathetic!  If Detroit plays like this in 7, they are done!  You cant win a hockey game in the finals when you play the last period.  12 shots by the end of the 2nd for Detroit...thats dominance for ya!!!

I think that a whole buncha "ifs" will have to come to pass for the Pens to win the cup, but hey, all those "ifs" have happened before so why not this time? The cup is there for either team to take, with the home ice advantage to Detroit. I'd say 3-2 odds in Detroit's favour.  JF

Im getting sick of pit scoring and osgood looking at everyone and shaking his head like it wasnt fair.....lol, the first goal last night, he just sat there shaking his head as if to say.........that was a Bull goal? And i think stalls goal in game four where he drove the net , same thing............seems as if hes saying, hey that wasnt my fault, or that was a Bull goal. Puck went in, you didnt stop it? Take a drink of water and stop the puck next time, stop shakin your head lol  Man would i love to see the Pens take this one away from detroit. IN DETROIT!!! Im not feeling lucky, but its down to one game, and ya never know
no worries 4-2 Detroit in game 7  it will be a big party in motor city again
Let's just hope it's good hockey.  I dunno about anyone else, but the first 2 games in the series were the best if you ask me in terms of action.
Last night was a good one too...fast paced...few whistles.  Fleury's breakaway save on Cleary at the end of the third was stellar
You are right .. the wings deserved that win .. what about the other 2 games
Whens the next Game
I was assuming it's tomorrow but it's Friday.  JF
Thanks, Good on the NHL putting it on Friday.  Too Bad I wont help the Ratings.
whatever the outcome is it is good to see 9 pages of people interested in the cup  cheers
yes 9 pages but only a handful of posters.
Hahaha, fair enough.

the above statement is definitely accurate. man did they crap the bed the other night. a little to cocky after game 4 i suppose... i dont' think talbot's comments about detroit looking tired and old was a great idea either...don't give the other team a REASON to prove you wrong...  should be a good game 6.
LOL, Now let the Sabres make another run, and ill be much more enthused in this discussion

Alright...let's get the discussion started again...lol........    Speaking of Talbot.......lovely hack on Datsyuk's foot. What a gutless, gutless move.  He just got back because of his foot, and you intentionally target it. Pathetic!

Like i said previously...the return of Draper and Pavel would make a huge difference...but man...5-0....expecting the Pittsburgh to show up not Wilkes Barre  The slash wasnt that bad...its being overblown...seen much worse....its the playoffs, not womens hockey.....The wings arent even make a deal out of it, just the media.

If the Pens didn't take those stupid penalties, it would have been a different game. There is the prove of inexperience on the Pens behalf.... young team, Came off a BIG win, a little cocky and got off of their game plan all together.  It will be a very exciting game 6 I believe. The Pens will take it and it will go to game 7 ! Just like everyone wanted !  Also my tickets to game 7 should triple in value
It wasnt a "bad" slash....it was however a GUTLESS one.

Lots of gutless things go on during a game that the viewer doesnt see, the camera just happened to catch that one...if it was reveresed, you probably wouldnt see it as gutless...just a feeble and weak attempt to gain the puck
Actually, I would. There's no room in hockey for cheap shots. IMO. No need for that garbage. You dont see any Detroit guy doing that. But then again...they don't need to.

We Pens fans sure are quiet.  That was a total embarassment.   I'm just glad I was stuck at my daughters' softball game and didn't make myself sit through that game.  I didn't see Talbot's slash but the no call trip/slash at the end of game 4 on Crosby was gutless too.  I can't remember who it was but it was gutless sour grapes when the game was over.

Stoty, your team is predominantly Euros...Are you seriously suggesting there isn't any "gutless" stick work going on from Detroit players? If you think that, Don Cherry and I would likely disagree with you.

WOAH WOAH WOAH.... Crosbys act he put on over that "slash" to the back of the leg should of got an award... Hes lucky the Wings didn't score on that play. He was CLEARLY trying to draw a penalty . Once the play was at the other end, all of a sudden hes all better. Im not sayin the slash on Datsyuk deserved a penalty because I think I was already asleep for it so I didn't see it.  But you can't compare the play on Crosby to anything that "deserves" a penalty ! Its almost like in game 4 when Helm took a slash to the hand.... sitting on the bench with an icepack being attended to by the trainer... that clearly did some damage.... Crosby went to the bench and was out next shift, didn't skip a beat. I consider it "gutless" when you lay on the ice for 10-20 seconds trying to act hurt... then when you relaize the play is at the other end and nothing is coming of it... skate off, wait... back on a minute later !

Let's face it, both teams' fans can rail on about the other teams dirty stuff with justification, and both teams have divers. Watch when a guy goes down. If the camera's on him you'll almost certainly see a sidelong glance to see if he's got the ref's attention.  After the series is over I'll ask my neighbour what he saw out there. he may or may not tell me. I saw him yesterday and almost called him over but since he's got one more game I figured he'd be cautious about what he said anyway. He's a linesman, btw.  JF

uh...ya right. How bout all the goaltender interferance? Those don't qualify right?  Personaly I think its ALL part of Physical series. A little less Body contact, and way more stick play then I would like to see in a traditional Playoff Game. But non the less Its still just part of an emotional high stress playoff game.
well, guess the wings decided to let us win the cup off of home ice this year. would of been nice to win at home, but nope now we got to win in the dirty Detroit.  Thanks Wings.
.............? Are you saying "we" as in the pegnuins ? If so....

Lunker,  You're talking about a different play.  I know which one you're talking about where he laid on the ice for a bit.  I'm talking about the one that occurred at the end of game 4 with about 2 minutes left.  He didn't lay on the ice at all.   He got right up but it was clearly a penalty.  The one you're talking about was a penalty too but I think that was game 3.  He just embellished it too much.
Here we go, game 6.
2 - 0 is good.  talk about home ice advantage
Game 7 here we come.
GAME 7
Paging mr stoty...

ya...??  Game 7 in Detroit....  I'm not the one who should be worried.  Pits didn't deserve to win that game, but hey..they got the lucky bounce this time. Fleury made some key saves when needed.  Should be a good game 7.

Well this is going to be interesting,  If Pitty plays like tonight, and the Wings bring their game 5 face.....game 7 will be good. But, Am I the only one who thought Malkan looked like a chump tonight? A ton of dipsy doodle plays on the blue line that truned over the puck when he should have been bringing or shooting it in deep? And taking a stupid penalty to boot....geesh Thank God Staal was on fire! With Kennedy adding a point it was the Northern Boys of Ontario stealing the show and bringing it to Detroit!

UHHHHHMMMMMMMM pit outshot outchanced and for the most part outplayed det and yes Fleury did make some key saves (in the the third especially)  but to say they got lucky cmon man give pit the credit they deserve  I could care less who wins but i hope you are right about game 7 It should be a dandy just hope it is a close game

This is a great thread...(some minor character assaults notwithstanding)...either way you slice it the hockey is exciting, and you can't help but feel the passion from both sides.  I have been impressed with the skill and control Detroit shows, but I can't help but hoot and holler when the Pens light it up!  Just seems like more heart, and now that they've proven they can outplay the Wings for long enough to win a game, I hope they can keep it going    Bring on the best of 3!!!
Some of us have very little character to assault.

Your right, if they were than Crosby and Malkin would be the best in the league right now.  Back to Scoty and his comment-  Pretty sure I myself didn't start to brag after last night's game. I said my plan and I'm going to stick to it. (pg 1) However, some members may of started there bragging after last night's game, but like you, I don't brag nor do i start thready feeling way cocky after 2 back to back wins. Good luck in game 5 and 6.
Bite your tongue

I agree... I love the guys who measure the success of a player buy their "points" I suppose by a measure of points a guy Like Scott Stevens, Guy Carbonneau, Larry Robinson are what....chumps? How about Danny Cleary? Would you throw him to the dogs cause he's not a point getter? Only 14 "points" but  +17 and the TOP plus minus on the team. Do you think Zetterburgs would be doing as well as he is with out him?  Heart of the team if you asked me....  Plus minus actually wins games, and says a lot about a players game play! This measures not only the goals and "points" you score, but the plays you set up, the situations you create, and leadership on the ice you provide, and the inspiration you instill in your line mates....and did I mention it minuses the mistakes your on the ice for? If your going to follow a number as opposed to an overall effectiveness an individual character...Plus/minus is a number to follow not "points"  But FYI,  Syd the Kid has 31 "points" and is +12 Malkins has 35 points but is only +3  In a pool sure I might pick Malkin but on my team, and especially my line....Syd is 4x more effective.
sweating just a bit
If Stoty was around right now, this is what he'd say...
Crosby's a suck, he's overrated and a dirty player... Cherry says the Euros are dirty... plenty of dirty Canadian players... what  vicious slash on Zetterberg...   Go Wings (aka team Sweden)
This series reminds me of the Oilers and Islanders.

Im glad the wings are winning... but I actually just spilt my bud all over me FALLING asleep during the third period of the game... I was hoping for a more exciting game... 5-0 wings tho, Ill take it !
Do I even need to say anything?
Guys like you always do...
LOL

Let me start by saying...I'm no fan of either team by long stretch of the imagination LOL! Go...ummmm....mmmm......who'd most likely to win this?....ummm I'll cheer for the underdog. Go Pens  But this... That there is funny!  That was a vicious slash? I suppose you thought the Zadane Head but was a colosal blow as well LOL!  Stupid penalty yes, Frustrated is he?....yes But vicious?...c'mon I've seen weed wackers hit harder then that Zetty "may" have embelished that one a bit....just a bit  Say what you want about Syd....he's still a star, like 'em or not. (insert Sour grapes here)

I guess I kinda fell into the "Hate The Rich Kid Who's Sucky" deal along with most of the hard-nosed hockey fans in the world, but the more I watch him, the more I like him. The announcers keep talking about how he works on developing his leg strength and it shows when he goes behind the net one handing the puck while he fends off some horse who probably outweighs him by 50 # or more. He does a lot of things really really well, and he makes or takes passes as well as anyone I can remember being impressed by in the past. He's proving hisself to be the real deal despite what his detractors would love to have us believe. They'd all be getting misty over him if only he played for their team. Yeah, he might have been a bit of a diver, prone to embellishment and whining in the past, but he's evolved into a really great player to watch, except perhaps for last night, but every superstar has bad days. For me Crosby looks like a player at least a notch above Malkin, but for show Malkin and OV are the big dogs. I'll still take a few lines of Crosbys with just a smattering of Malkins and OVs to draw the crowds to pay for the entertainment.  Malkin is great, no doubt about it, but to a different degree. He may mature into a smarter player one day but he's got a lot to learn to be Sid's equal as a contributor. He reminds me so much of OV. He's not quite the hotdog OV is, but he's every bit the MeMe player. Watch how he cruises looking for a break out pass, and then wastes an opportunity by dipseydoodling through the other team usually just getting pushed off the puck. He's not quite as overt as OV about it, simply standing up at the offensive blueline setting a tape target for whoever has the puck, but he's not as smart or as willing to muck for the puck as Sid. Crosby gives away opportunities when he sees guys in better places. Malkin just wants the puck - period. That being said I believe there was a very nice passing play recently when he fed Sid, but those are few and too far between for me.  I wondered if Datsyuk would be in top form when he came back. I guess we got our answer. He kinda owned the play last night. How much of that is having the home ice advantage and very good line management on the bench will be answered in the next game.  I'm knocked out by the depth of Detroit. They're having to sit guys who are playoff stars. Sucks to be Pittsburgh then huh? I guess the unanswered question is will these guys be stars in a few years when the old farts have migrated to the retired players lounge to watch the games. Detroit has pretty good chemistry right now. Can they sustain it without Lidstrom et al?  The Pens looked kinda lost after that initial flurry, speaking of which, I wasn't impressed with Fleury last night, but then even star goalies can't be incredible every night.  The next game will be interesting. Perhaps the Pens will show us that this is a homer series. Whatever they do next I have my doubts they can win the Cup this year, but heaven knows, they're getting closer all the time. If they can keep some of the rear guard guys for a year or two more they're gonna bring that cup home. I'm not sure if I'll be a fan ever. One never knows when the Leafs might pull out of the slump. But unless the Leafs start their inevitable comeback soon I guess Crosby and the Pens will be my default team.  JF

Ditto, And last night proved a point...older or not they got the goods. Nothing pisses and old guy off then being called and old guy LOL!  Kinda a crappy one way game though... Some stupid penalties, and a team scorned makes for a great first and second period if they are your team... But after that its just boreing
There's always the next game.  JF
Crossing my fingers, but then again...once it over I can stop watching, and focus on fishing a bit more
Pens fans are a little quiet today!
Just regrouping like Detroit fans did after Games 3 & 4. Hockey is great for taking the wind out of the sails.  JF

Hey ya never know. I haven't had much to cheer about for quite a while but my favorites, the big bad Bruins turned things around in the last couple of years and at least made it out of the first round against those pesky habs. That's like winning the cup right there.   Anything else is just a bonus after that.  Crosby deserves a lot of credit. He performs well even with three wings all over him. Classic. Points are the only measure of a hockey player.

The Pens have surprised me, for sure.  Didn't think Fleury had it in him.    He still scares me.  Crosby has hardly been invisible.   He's set up more good scoring chances than anyone.   Ask Babcock.  He's tying up the Wings best players and making them chase him all over.   The Wings are devoting so much time to contain him he's making Malkin the most productive player in this series, on the second line nonetheless.  He's made Osgood the second most productive player.  He's had a ton of chances and he's set up even more.   Ozzie's been pretty darn good.  The Wings are starting to argue among themselves on the ice too.  I like that.   Talk about whining, on every draw they were complaining to the refs.  The officiating hasn't been great either way but there is no doubt but they have gotten away alot of neutral zone interference.   The Versus commentators talk about it constantly.   The Pens fans may have been down after being 0-2 (just like any fan would against Detroit) but the only thing worse was the cockiness of the Wings fans.    C'mon Stoty, you know this one isn't over yet.  Odds still favor the Wings but it's going to be a fun ride.   Few bad bounces and goals and the Pens could very well be up in this series.    Barry Melrose said it best.   The Pens weren't sure they had a chance, now they know they do.  The Wings thought it was locked up.  Now they know it's no sure thing.   Attitude favors the Pens.  Sure hope the Wings get some rest.   They sure need it.  In any event, the Pens aren't making a bad showing for a team that had a slim shot at the playoffs with a month left the season.    Being such big underdogs in this series, the pressure is on the Wings.

It was making me dizzy watching from home, so I can just imagine what the Red Wings felt like. The wings are lucky to have only allowed 4 goals. It could have been much worse.  Having said that, I think Detroit will come out strong in game 5. What happens after that is a crap shoot.

Detroit is my team. So ofcourse Im a little Biased.  Hossa, in game one, did cover the puck which should have been a penalty shot. Can't blame the wings for that though, the Ref didn't do his job. In game 2, he DID NOT cover the puck, in the replay showing a view from the front of the net you can clearly see the puck on the ice WITH OUT Hossa covering it. Now lucky bounces in hockey are part of the game. Sometimes they go your way, some times they dont. At the moment, Detroit has them going there way. Frustration is a huge part of the game aswell... the Pens are to young of a team, they are VERY frustrated right now. Malkin proved that with his rediculous show at the end of the game last night with Zetterburg. He honestly looked like a kid throwing a fit. He was tossing hay makers with his stick still in his hands ??? Come on now... that was just embarrasing. Fleury hasn't shown up in this series yet. Detroits first goal was a lucky bounce off the boards, but other than that they have been good goals. Osgood is amazing. He does not get the credit he deserves. Crosby, well for being 21, and the leader of an NHL team at such a young age. I think he is doing a pretty good job. He also hasn't shown up in this series yet either. Last night hit the post and if Osgoods pad would have been about .25" lower to the ice, he would have had a goal and a tie game. But again, the bounce just didn't go his way. To the person who said Crosby is a "whiney baby" maybe you should check out his team mate Malkin.... Pens. coach should have called a time out when they iced the puck after that long shift. That was a mistake on his part and in turn, Detroit capitalized.  Detroit has so much talent right across the board. To expect to win against them with a couple star players. Well its not going to happen. I wanted to see an exciting series as much as anyone else. But on the other hand... its just as sweet to watch Detroit teach the young Pens how to win !  Detroit in 5 games. ( I say that only so they can win at home  ) haha

Detroit is impressive, but they've been getting the lucky end of the bounces...plain and simple.  They may have more self-control and discipline overall, and be less likely to be rattled, compared to the Pens...but so far they aren't winning these games by domination, or even on their own merits entirely.  Pittsburgh has shown that they can outplay them...but only in spurts.  Good hockey either way you cut it, and I'm not a devoted fan of either team, but the more I watch, the more I want to see the Pens win, or at least see Detroit earn their goals instead of get lucky bounces.
